intro: Jungia sordida, commonly known as the dirty jungle plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense undergrowth. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and ecologists studying tropical flora.
